au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.internal

Class BatchMacroSubstituter

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.internal.BatchMacroSubstituter

  • public class BatchMacroSubstituter
extends java.lang.Object
    Macro substituter for the configured batch runner.

    Substitutes macro variables into a string. All variables must be prefixed with '--' and end in '--'. The following is the list of macro variable name and macro value pairs.

    • __FILE__ - Filename provided as a construction parameter.
    • __USER__ - User name provided as a construction parameter.
    • __DAY_OF_MONTH__ - Day of the month in two digit numerical format.
    • __MONTH__ - Month in two digit numerical format.
    • __YEAR__ - ISO-8601 year number.
    • __HOUR__ - 24-hour format of an hour with leading zeros.
    • __MINUTE__ - Minutes with leading zeros.
    • __SECOND__ - Seconds with leading zeros.
    • __ISO8601__ - ISO 8601 formatted date.
    • __EPOCH__ - Seconds since the Unix Epoch.
    NOTE:For any date/time macros, the value is the time specified by a Calendar instance provided as a construction parameter or if none provided, the current date/time.

      • substituteMacros

        public java.lang.String substituteMacros(java.lang.String str)
        Returns the provided string with any macro variables substituted with their macro values. If null is passed as a parameter, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        str - string to replace macros with values
        Returns:
        value substituted string

      • addLeadingZeros

        protected java.lang.String addLeadingZeros(int val)
        Returns a string containing a two digit representation of the provided string. If the val contains a single digit, a '0' character is prepended to the string.
        Parameters:
        val - value to add leading zero if less then two digits long
        Returns:
        two digit representation of the provided value
